description:
O.J. Simpson was more than a football star. More than a pop culture icon or a defendant acquitted of murder.

He became a symbol of America's complicated relationship to race, celebrity, and justice. His family announced that he died of cancer Wednesday at age 76.

The murder trial of O.J. Simpson became not only about one man and two victims, but the entire country. Coming up, we assess the legacy of a case, and a verdict, that put race in America on the stand.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: O.J. Simpson's trial divided the nation. What legacy does he leave behind?

description: Ownership of the Spratly Islands are in dispute. This has been the case for decades, but tensions have been raised recently as China has tried to expand its claims in the remote area. We get a rare glimpse of one of the islands that has a Filipino community living on it.
title: A Remote Island Outpost that is Part of a Geopolitical Fight

description: The VA halted foreclosures after an NPR investigation found thousands of vets were facing foreclosure and it wasn't their fault. Now the VA's unveiling a rescue plan that leaves some out in the cold.
title: The VA has its fix for a home loan debacle, but many vets who got hurt won't get help

description: Atlantic journalist Stephanie McCrummen says foreign interests are acquiring territory in Northern Tanzania, effectively displacing indigenous cattle-herders from their traditional grazing lands.
title: Journalist says a 'land grab' in Tanzania is forcing the Maasai off their land

description: FBI agents in high-cost areas can face long commutes and trouble paying the bills. Their advocates are asking for a housing allowance to lighten the load.
title: Many FBI agents are struggling to make ends meet. Housing costs are to blame

description: Orenthal James Simpson "succumbed to his battle with cancer" on Wednesday, according to a family statement on social media.
title: O.J. Simpson, football legend acquitted of notorious killings, dies at 76

description: Almost everyone fled Sderot after Hamas militants killed 50 residents and visitors on Oct. 7. Now most have returned, but soldiers are guarding schools and residents are traumatized and feel insecure.
title: Israelis are returning to Sderot, the biggest city attacked by Hamas

description: Doctors have coined a term to describe places where blood for transfusions is not readily available: "blood deserts." When blood banks aren't around, they try different strategies to help patients.
title: Here are 3 solutions to get blood to folks in 'blood deserts.' One is often illegal

description: President Biden hosts the leaders of Japan and the Philippines. Fewer high school seniors are completing their FAFSA form.
title: Biden to hold summit with Japan, Philippines; FAFSA delays threaten college enrollment

description: Avian influenza is still spreading among dairy cattle. Scientists are paying close attention to how the virus is changing and what that means for its pandemic potential.
title: Here's what worries scientists about bird flu's spread among cattle

description: It's been 30 years since the Rwandan genocide. In some places today, survivors live side-by-side with perpetrators in so-called reconciliation villages.
title: In this Rwandan village, survivors and perpetrators of the genocide live side by side

description: Doxxing campaigns have been used to "name and shame" people who have expressed opinions about the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Most doxxing campaigns only last a few days. But the effects can be felt for months

description: The Justice Department's new rule requires background checks for all gun sales, not just ones sold at gun stores. Attorney General Merrick Garland said it will save lives.
title: Here's the new plan to boost background checks for guns bought at shows or online

description: How far do women have to travel to access abortion care? An economics professor has been tracking that data since 2009. Interactive maps show how access has changed dramatically since 2021.
title: How Florida and Arizona Supreme Court rulings change the abortion access map

description: Economists sent 83,000 fake job applications to a slew of major U.S. companies, and found that the typical firm favored white applicants over Black ones by around 9%.
title: White-sounding names get called back for jobs more than Black ones, a new study finds

description: April 15th, the deadline to file your income taxes, is just around the corner. Filings so far this year are on track with last year's, while the average refund is slightly larger.
title: Five things to know as the tax deadline looms

description: About 250 Filipinos live on Thitu Island, the largest and most inhabited island of the Spratlys, in the South China Sea. But Chinese ships are never far away.
title: On a remote island, a test of wills between the Philippines and China

description: Skinny jeans are out and looser pants are in. But it's so much more than that. This is the logic and life cycle behind fashion trends.
title: So long, skinny jeans. See you in the next cycle

description: Japan is giving the U.S. 250 new cherry trees to help replace the hundreds that are being ripped out this summer as construction crews work to repair the seawall around the capital's Tidal Basin.
title: Japan will give new cherry trees to replace those lost in D.C. construction

description: South Korea's liberal opposition wins nearly two-thirds of the seats in parliamentary elections, blowing a crushing defeat to President Yoon Suk Yeol.
title: South Korea's opposition wins in landslide parliamentary elections
